definition: extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me

sentences.english: I stirred up the cinders, and fetched a scuttleful myself.
sentences.chinese: 我搅动一下那些余烬，自己去取了一煤斗的煤。

sentences.english: At the end of the poem, the embers of my fire are about to be snuffed out.
sentences.chinese: 在诗的结尾，我生命之火的余烬即将熄灭。

sentences.english: But will the embers of a different kind of heresy continue to burn?
sentences.chinese: 但不同种类的异端邪说的余烬今后是否还会再燃？

sentences.english: So the Jack-O-Lantern in America was a hollowed-out pumpkin, lit with an ember.
sentences.chinese: 因此，南瓜灯笼是在美国一镂空的南瓜，用余烬点燃。
夜啊在余烬里发出红光。

sentences.english: The incinerated body still lay curled in its wooden bed of cinders.
sentences.chinese: 那具未曾烧尽的尸体还蜷缩在木床的余烬里。

sentences.english: He sank into the chair, and brooded over the embers, and shed tears.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在椅子上，望着火炉的余烬兀自出神，淌着眼泪。

sentences.english: Outside, leaf shadows twist and fall like embers.
sentences.chinese: 外面，树叶的阴影扭曲着下降，像余烬一般。

sentences.english: A big bed of embers still gleamed in the kitchen chimney .
sentences.chinese: 大片的余烬还在厨房烟囱里冒着火星。

sentences.english: To the right and left, Dany glimpsed places where the grass was burned and ashen.
sentences.chinese: 丹妮在左右都能看到被烧毁的草丛余烬。

sentences.english: The remains of the fire glowed for hours.
sentences.chinese: 火的余烬好几小时都发着光亮。

sentences.english: Thick black smoke poured out of the building and showered the ground with embers.
sentences.chinese: 又黑又厚的浓烟滚滚，余烬不断地掉向地面。

sentences.english: It would be more efficient to burn better quality coal that left less ash, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他表示燃烧优质且余烬少的媒会更有效率。

sentences.english: Scatter, as from an unextinguish'd hearth Ashes and sparks.
sentences.chinese: 就像从未灭的余烬飏出炉灰和火星。

sentences.english: She had to sift ashes from the cinders .
sentences.chinese: 那具未曾烧尽的尸体还蜷缩在木床的余烬里。

sentences.english: Archer stooped over and threw a log upon the embers.
sentences.chinese: 阿切尔弯下身，往余烬上扔了一块木柴。

definition: to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
to extinguish/to put out (fire)/to quench/to stop burning/to go out (of fire, lamp etc)/to come to an end/to wither away/to die out/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
tinder/source of a fire/inflammable material/(fig.) spark (of a revolution etc)
